document.masterDocTitle: Velvet ants of the tribe Smicromyrmini Bischoff (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) of Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Velvet ants of the tribe Smicromyrmini Bischoff (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) of Japan

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Mutilla wotani
Zavattari, 1913: 27
, ♀ , lectotype ♀ (“ Tainan ”, Taiwan ) [SDEI, designated by Mickel (1933) ], examined;
Sonan 1931: 7
, ♀ , examined.

Smicromyrme orientalis taiwanensis :
Tsuneki 1972c: 16
, ♂ , in part, examined, misidentification.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Smicromyrme ( Horaia ) chihpenchia Tsuneki, 1993a
,
syn. nov.
: 43, ♂ , holotype ♂ (“Chihpenchi”, Taitung , Taiwan ) [MNHAH], examined.

Diagnosis. MALE. Gena with large sparse punctures; clypeus basomedially elevated forming basal and subbasal denticles, and with a pair of subapical weak tubercles. Dense recumbent pale setae on dorsum of pronotum short, mixed with sparse long erect pale setae; lateral face of pronotum posteriorly transversely puncto-striate; scutellum and metascutellum with long erect pale golden setae; ventral tubercle on mesopleuron laterally at most flattened; propodeum with basomedial elongate to semicircular cell and with large semicircular cell laterally to median one. Metasomal segments 1–3 yellowish red. FEMALE. Frons with sparse golden to black recumbent setae; frons and vertex with dense but separated punctures. T2 with apical narrow band of pale golden to golden setae, medially widened triangularly; T6 with thickened lateral pygidial fringe of pale golden setae; pygidial area rugoso-striate basally, unsculptured on apical 1/6–1/5.

Type materials examined.
Mutilla wotani Zavattari
: lectotype , ♀ ( Figs 10 E–F, 15C, 16C, 17G–I, 18F), Tainan , Taiwan , VIII.1909 , Hans Sauter leg. [ SDEI (DEI-GISHym 16749)].
Smicromyrme chihpenchia Tsuneki
: holotype , ♂ ( Figs 9 C–D, 11C–D, 12D–F, K, 13F–G), Chihpenchi, Taitung , Taiwan , 12.VIII.1976 , Tadao Murota leg. [MN- HAH (B1-288585)].

Other materials examined. 3♂ 20♀ .
Taiwan :

Mutilla wotani Zavattari, B. Petersen
det. 1987 as

[ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , Xindian, Xinbei, VIII.1920 , S. Inamura leg., B. Petersen det. 1987 as
Smicromyrme wotani wotani (Zavattari)
[ TARI ]; 1♀ , Xinhua, Tainan , 5.V.1925 , S. Takano leg. [ HUM ]; 1♀ , Chuchi, Chiayi , 15.XI.1926 , J. Sonan leg. [ HUM ]; 1♀ , same data, B. Petersen det. 1987 as
Smicromyrme wotani wotani Zavattari
[ TARI ]; 5♀ , Taipei , 25.IX.1927 , J. Sonan leg., B. Petersen det. 1987 as
Smicromyrme wotani wotani (Zavattari)
[ TARI ]; 1♀ , Pengfutao, VII.1930 , S. Minowa leg., B. Petersen det. 1987 as
Smicromyrme wotani wotani Zavattari
[ TARI ]; 1♀ , Chiayi , 30.IX.1933 , J. Sonan leg., B. Petersen det. 1987 as
Smicromyrme wotani wotani Zavattari
[ TARI ]; 1♂ , Chihpen, Beinan, Taitung , 15.VIII.1936 , K. Iida leg., A. S. Lelej det. 1995 as
Nemka wotani (Zavattari)
[ NSMT ]; 1♀ , same place, 18.VIII.1936 , K. Iida leg., A. S. Lelej det. 1995 as
Nemka wotani (Zavattari)
[ NSMT ]; 1♀ , Yujing, Tainan , 2.VII.1937 , J. Sonan leg., B. Pe- tersen det. 1987 as
Smicromyrme wotani wotani (Zavattari)
[ TARI ]; 1♀ , Chuchi, Chiayi , 18.VI.1941 , Y. Yano leg. [ ELKU ]; 1♂ ( Fig. 13B ), Chihpen, Taitung , 30.VI.1968 , K. Tsuneki leg., K. Tsuneki det. 1972 as
Smicromyrme orientalis taiwanensis Mickel
(probably Petersen’s hand) [ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , Tulan, Taichung , 5.VII.1968 , K. Tsuneki leg., K. Tsuneki det. 1972 as
Smicromyrme wotani (Zavattari)
[ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , Hengchun, Pingtung , 17.VII.1968 , K. Tsuneki leg., K. Tsuneki det. 1972 as
Smicromyrme wotani (Zavattari)
[ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , Chuchi, Chiayi , 24–25.VII.1968 , K. Tsuneki leg. [ NMNH ]; 1♂ ( Figs 14 D–47F), same data, K. Tsuneki det. 1972 as
Smicromyrme orientalis taiwanensis Mickel
(probably Petersen’s hand) [ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , Chuchi, Chiayi , 24–25.VII.1968 , K. Tsuneki leg., K. Tsuneki det. 1972 as
Smicromyrme wotani (Zavattari)
[ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , same place, 26.VII.1968 , K. Tsuneki leg., K. Tsuneki det. 1972 as
Smicromyrme wotani (Zavattari)
[ ZMUC ]; 1♀ , Chihpen, Beinan, Taitung , 9.VIII.1981 , collector unknown [ MTC ].
Other localities in the literature. All the distributional records are confirmed in this study.

Synonymic notes.
Smicromyrme ilanica Tsuneki, 1972
was described from Taiwan and subsequently transferred to
Mickelomyrme
by Lelej (1995a) . Although the original description of this species did not include essential information to place it in
Nemka
rather than
Mickelomyrme
, judging from type photos provided by “Integrated insect types database of Taiwanese species” (http://twinsecttype.nmns.edu.tw/, accessed 7 May 2019 ), this species is a junior synonym of
N . wotani
.

Tsuneki (1972c) listed 11 males of
Sm . orientalis taiwanensis ( Mickel, 1933 )
(currently
N . taiwanensis
) collected in Taiwan , of which two were mentioned as having apical three segments black (like true
N . taiwanensis
) and remaining nine as having apical four segments black. The former specimens were examined in the present study and actually belonged to
N . wotani
. The male of
N . wotani
differs from
N . taiwanensis
by the presence of basal and subbasal denticles and a pair of subapical tubercles ( Lelej 1995a ). The remaining nine males with the four apical black segments belong to unknown species of
Mickelomyrme ( Lelej 1995a )
.

Tsuneki (1993a) described
N . chihpenchia
as having “propodeum without enclosed area”. This feature was included in Lelej’s (1995a) key to separate the male of
N . chihpenchia
from that of
N . wotani
. However, the holotype of
N . chihpenchia
has a basomedial semicircular cell and a similar cell laterally to it. No other differences were found. Therefore, this species is synonymized under
N . wotani
here.
